Hello there.

The name's Peter Albert Weir, but my friends call me Bert. Well, that’s not entirely true. One guy does (thanks Steve), and if I have learned anything, it's that creating your own nickname is really, really difficult. What about Petey?

At any rate—I was born in Montreal, raised in Victoria, BC, and have most recently resided in Toronto, where I completed a Master of Digital Media at Ryerson University.

What I do.

I'm into design and have a background in digital marketing and media production. I also enjoy writing, both critically and creatively, and do a little acting every now and then.

It may seem like my interests are all over the place, but, someday somehow, I will figure out a way of synthesizing them into one glorious pursuit.

Some fast facts.

  • 19.8K followers
  • Portuguese descent
  • Chair-themed account
  • Airship enthusiast

Other stuff.

I’m happiest when hanging out with friends, perusing the depths of IMDb, crushing podcasts, and collaborating on ideas. I believe that heaven is a place on Earth and that place is the Oregon Dunes.

For real—I just wanna work on great things and share some laughs along the way.

Here I am enjoying a cup of tea.

Articles/Blog Posts

As someone whose background includes way too much content marketing, I am well-acquainted with the norms and nuances of quality writing. You could call me the Ernest Hemingway of corporate blogging. All I need is a little rundown of your audience, a sense of your goals, and what you’re hoping to ultimately convey in the message. (This will help me devise strong, competitive keywords that don't feel synthetic if you know what I mean.)

Seriously though, don’t worry about the tone, pacing, and formality—I’ll examine your existing posts and figure it out for myself.

Copywriting

Imagine this: a startup is trying to redesign the bike helmet, and they’ve approached me for an upcoming campaign. But this isn’t a design problem. It never was. It’s a wariness thing. A stigma that needs to be destigmatized. So, I put the pen to the paper and fire out: Better safe than sexy.

Not sure if that’s been done before, but it’s pretty decent, no? Anyway, I’m rather comfortable with producing copy and virtually anything related to messaging. Be it for press releases, weekly newsletters, print/digital campaigns, social media, web content, internal communications—literally anything. Better safe than sexy. Not. Too. Bad.

Scriptwriting

You know what my proudest accomplishment is? Something I’ve dreamed of doing since 1999, when, as a 7 year-old boy, I saw Space Jam for the first time? Something I’ve grappled with for over a decade, trying and failing only to try and fail again? Write a screenplay. And in June, 2017, I laid my fingers on the keyboard and typed the following words: THE END. Yup, I had finally completed my very first, totally-original, feature-length screenplay. Prior to that fateful day, I had read dozens of books on the art of screenwriting, but it wasn’t until I actually started pumping out dialogue that I truly understood what it takes.

I can be your second pair of eyes, your doctor, your narrative guru. I can deliver scripts for lowly commercials, how-to videos, or even episodic television. I mean, I’m no Blake Snyder or Shonda Rhimes, but my optics are pretty darn good.

Branding

Like a young child in a room full of Lego, I relish the chance to build a brand, from the ground up, layer by layer, brick by brick. Even if there’s no foundation whatsoever, I’m happy to—wait a minute. Now that I think about it, the less in place the better. Such as, you know, the absence of a core identity, including something as basic as a name.

I’ll help establish all of the necessities, both visual and, uh, not visual: colour scheme, logo, tagline, a mission/vision/values statement, the freaking coat of arms, if you will. Or the elements that shape your brand’s spirit, like the messaging, attitude, and general flavour. Everything that’s required to instill even just a penny of brand equity. Because this kind of stuff excites the hell out of me, so let’s have some fun.

Concept Development

One of my favourite activities is logging new ideas. Through my concept and venture journal, I have documented tens upon tens of different ideas, fleshing them out over time, making edits here and there—the whole nine yards. No matter how big or small, whether it’s a new app, a brick and mortar business, or a podcast series, no idea is a bad idea. That is, unless real, everyday people say otherwise.

I find great enjoyment in appraising ideas. Should you be in need of some market validation, lends me your thoughts and I’ll challenge them from every angle.

Onscreen Work

Believe it or not, but once upon a time, this young man dreamed of becoming a proper, honest-to-goodness, Hollywood-gaming actor. I should clarify: a screen actor. I’m no theatre-dwelling thespian. I’d like to be, but I don’t have the gumption quite yet. (That's why I signed up for improv classes earlier this year. An experience that, aside from being tremendously fun and enriching, has ingited my passion anew.)

All of this to say, I’m decently comfortable in front of the camera. You know, like a Millennial incarnation of Ryan Seacrest. Hosting, moderating, or even reciting dialogue and straight up pretending.

Web Design/Development

These past few years have taught me a lot about web design and development. Namely, that it’s practically impossible to know enough. Because there’s always—ALWAYS—something new, something more, or something different to learn. Anyway, I’m well-versed in the fundamentals of front-end design. HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, some PHP, you know, you know.

UX/UI Design

I completed a Masters of Digital Media, ok? Trust me on this one. I did specialize in UX design, after all. So I must know what I’m doing!

Joking aside, my graduate thesis explored the confluence of UX design and electronic word-of-mouth. I have pored over every research paper, industry report, and academic study there is on the topic. Heck, my graduate project involved designing a mobile application that is perfectly suited to the overtones and undertones of contemporary UX. In any case, I am more than happy to assist with any related needs.

Graphic Design

Although I've spent much of my life flirting with Photoshop, Illustrator, and yes, InDesign, I never really considered myself a pro. Just adept. But not anymore.

Since March of 2018, I have dramatically broadened my understanding of graphic design. And like any craft, I did so by doing. To see what I'm alluding to, check out the Birthday Movie Posters project under my portfolio.
